properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-02-22T04:56:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2020-02-21T12:56:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4294083931.2020
Area: Stuart - Nechako

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Total snowfall: 2 to 4 cm. Maximum wind gusts: 80 km/h. Time span: this morning until this afternoon. Remarks: Fresh snowfall will combine with strong northwesterly winds are producing poor visibility in blowing snow. The snow and winds are expected to taper off this afternoon. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-02-21T23:05:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-21T12:11:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0926849893.2020
Area: Postville - Makkovik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Hamlet Of Sunset View Beach Located In The R.m. Of Mervin No. 499
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Hamlet of Sunset View Beach located in the R.M. of Mervin No. 499. The advisory is for the entire Hamlet of Sunset View Beach and for any individuals who may access the Sunset View Beach water system. The advisory is in effect until March 2nd, 2020.
Expires: 2020-03-06T11:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Turtleford and RM of Mervin, 2020-02-21T11:22:05-06:00, E55860F8-8A52-A1C9-A5F4-9492D55EC6B7
Area: R.M. of Mervin No. 499
properties.Author: SK Turtleford and RM of Mervin

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frequent snow squalls producing near zero visibilities will continue. Locations: Corner Brook to Port aux Basques. Time span: today. Additional snowfall accumulations: 2 to 4 cm, potentially 10 cm in snow squalls. Remarks: Snow squalls will taper off to flurries late this afternoon or early this evening. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Snow squall warnings are issued when bands of snow form that produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-02-21T21:59:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-21T08:56:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2974386931.2020
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity, Corner Brook and vicinity, Bay St. George
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Light to moderate northwest winds combined with temperatures near -40 have produced wind chill values of -50 to -55 in Iqaluit. Conditions will improve slightly today, but extreme wind chill values below -50 will redevelop on Friday night. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-22T01:21:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-21T09:22:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2197739895.2020
Area: Iqaluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are no longer expected to reach extreme cold warning criteria. ###

Area: Northern Peninsula East, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills continues. The coldest wind chill values will be near minus 55. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-22T07:10:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-21T15:10:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3738953508.2020
